properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 5 at 3:14AM MST until February 8 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS EARLY THIS MORNING FOR AREAS WEST OF THE
LARAMIE RANGE...

...BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW LIKELY IN THE WIND PRONE AREAS OF
SOUTHEAST WYOMING THROUGH MID DAY THURSDAY...

...BLIZZARD CONDITIONS POSSIBLE ALONG INTERSTATE 80 WEST OF
LARAMIE THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...WITH HEAVY SNOW LIKELY
SPREADING INTO THE INTERSTATE 25 CORRIDOR...

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, periods of blowing snow
expected. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow and blizzard
conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches
with locally higher amounts possible. Wind gusts up to 65 MPH
possible.

* WHERE...Interstate 80 between Laramie and Rawlins.

* WHEN...Winter Weather Advisory until 2 PM MST Thursday. The
Winter Storm Watch is in effect from 2 PM Thursday until 5 AM
MST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Travel may be extremely dangerous or impossible due to
icy, snow covered roads and whiteout conditions in falling and
blowing snow.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the
latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT
